It is NTR by definition, but it's a pretty weak one. Strong NTR is when we have a reason to like the girl and/or care about her relationship with the cuck. That's not the case in this manga. The girl is unlikeable as hell and the MC just thinks she's hot. >Female friend is horny and has sex with someone who isn't the MC. Wow, so painful. The NTR aspect is completely irrelevant and unnecessary, so yeah, I understand why most people wouldn't consider it NTR. Also, there is no element of humiliation and lies. The girl doesn't hide anything and MC even has a dick the same size as the friend's. This is more like a reverse harem than anything.

Anyways in this case, MC can just be like "So you're ok with just being my side chick?" and just keep her as a side chick or FWB. No rule saying he had to go out with or marry who he loves. *shrugs*  Sorry for the spammy comments.

Also want to point out that just because MC getting NTR'd it doesn't mean he is a cuck. Because he wasn't in a romantic relationship with the girl.  It's like if you're first crush in high school was going out with someone else instead, you got NTR'd but you're not a cuck. LOL :P

@Kamui67 I will second Metroid here as it is indeed netorare from the perspective of the MC. If you look into it on the internet, urban dictionary youtube channels...etc. they will generally say Netorare = Cuckholding/Cheating but this is in fact incorrect. Cuckolding/cheating is just one part of Netorare. It is a Japanese genre that does not have an English equivalent. It is when MC's loved one(can be a mother, relative, childhood friend, crush and even someone else's wife) that gets stolen from them(which could mean that their interaction with them, which may not even be direct contact, gets destroyed due to them paying more attention to someone else). 
For example the MC could just be admiring the lady in the flower shop everyday he goes to school, he doesn't have to make contact with her, but in his head he's having a Great Gatsby dream. One day she is seen fucking her husband and he feels sad because the lady is paying attention to her husband instead of him. This technically NTR.
Good art with shit story, what a waste talent

Let's imagine this realistically for a second. Two of your close friends from highschool go to the same college. Time passes, and you all decide to catch up. You find out that they have been fucking, that's completely ok because you're all adults, and they see each other all of the time. They invite you to have a threesome, and everyone gets laid. It's a little bit sad because you've always had a crush on the girl, but you never made a move. 

This situation is a win. It's very immature to be upset about this kind of thing, especially if you didn't ever make your feelings known.

You can tell that people who think this is NTR have ZERO experience with adult relationships.

I know this one asian couple from high school they dated like almost the full 4 years. Catholic. Innocent. Reserved. Kawaii. Like they strongly advocated traditional values and did not tolerate anything else. Once put me down made me feel humiliated when I talked about something vulgar...etc. Then BAM! first year university I see the girl posting picture of her in bed with older guys in her lingerie like wtf!?! Found out the couple broke up and she in an open relationship with some black dude. I was so pissed! Bitch was all hotstuff  and perfect putting me down and shit made me feel inferior in class (She spoke like I done the taboo and that she and her family for generations have been upright..etc. and so I started being more reserved "pure"), it changed the way I see girls forever. There was a small period where I started hating all girls and their fake ass acts. Fuck! Sorry, I apologize for the rant, this manga reminded me of that bitch.

Well this is interesting. Honestly, this is kind of realistic in the sense that those innocent girls you liked turn to sluts when they go to college. So many people I know turned out like that and it feels melancholic. Like I get they can do what they want and stuff but in high school they were like angels so their standards, expectations and friend group was of a different kind than when they are in university.
